sub_title: Self-Propelled Art Historian | Editor | Graphic Artist | Heritage Specialist | Religious Studies Scholar | PhD at Radboud University Nijmegen
summary:
■  As an art historian, heritage specialist and religious studies scholar, I am well acquainted with the complexity of preserving and presenting cultural heritage and individual historical artifacts. My PhD research, which I defended in 2018, is devoted to Dutch portraits in the guise of Biblical figures. I am also co-author of "Rembrandt: The Complete Paintings" XXL (Taschen).

S P E C I A L I S M S
■   Early Modern European Art (Renaissance and Baroque)
■   ■   Northern European Art 1400-1800 
■   ■   ■   Flemish and Dutch Painting of the 16th-17th Centuries / Portraiture
■   ■   ■   ■    Rembrandt | The Biblical "Portrait Historié" in the Northern Netherlands

■   I have extensive experience with education, editorials, organizing conferences, grant applications, compiling loan lists, oeuvre & exhibition catalogues, diplomatic & critical transcription, digitization of source texts, & development of user-friendly websites & search interfaces. I have an extensive network in museums & academia, the heritage sector & digital humanities. https://sites.google.com/view/karel-van-mander-academy/

■   SPECIALISMS / FIELDS OF INTEREST
■   Marian iconography
pinterest.com/uileand/aeiparthenos/
pinterest.com/uileand/iconesmariae/
pinterest.com/uileand/marianshrine/
pinterest.com/uileand/formaemariae/

■   Pictorial tradition of mysticism, dissenterism, esoterism, preternatural: 
pinterest.com/uileand/dissenterism/
pinterest.com/uileand/quintessence/
pinterest.com/uileand/otherwordly/

■   Mid-century German ceramics: 
https://nl.pinterest.com/uileand/mid-century-ceramics/
https://nl.pinterest.com/uileand/pop-space-lava-ceramics/
https://nl.pinterest.com/uileand/west-german-art-pottery/

■   Ik ben een kunsthistoricus, erfgoedspecialist en religiewetenschapper, die goed bekend is met de complexiteit van het conserveren en presenteren van cultureel erfgoed en afzonderlijke historische artefacten. Mijn in 2018 verdedigde promotieonderzoek is gewijd aan Nederlandse portretten in de gedaante van Bijbelse figuren.

■   Ik heb ruime ervaring met educatie, hoofd- en eindredactie, het organiseren van congressen, subsidieaanvragen, het samenstellen van bruikleenlijsten, oeuvre- en tentoonstellingscatalogi, diplomatieke en kritische transcriptie, de digitalisering van bronteksten, de ontwikkeling van gebruiksvriendelijke websites en zoekinterfaces.  Ik sta op vriendschappelijke voet met mijn collega’s in de museale en academische wereld en kan bogen op een uitgebreid netwerk in de erfgoedsector en eHumanities.

treasury_media.title: Historisch Bewijs - verfzakjes van Rembrandt - handschriftexpert
treasury_media.description: Legend has it that Rembrandt gave some of his own pouches with paint to his friend Jan Six, and that this unique gift has remained in the family's possession eversince. The team researches the little satchells of pig bladder with pigments from the Six Collection. To determine the vericity of the story once and for all, the pouches and pigments are examined. Paleographer Rudie van Leeuwen analyzes the handwritten labels of the pouches. SE1 EP2, Feb 12, 2020 8:30 PM: https://npostart.nl/AT_2127974

treasury_media.title: KVMA - The Karel van Mander Academy (Logo)
treasury_media.description: KVMA The Karel van Mander Academy is a group of scholars, who offer ready to use guidelines for the description of art, architecture, and develop conceptual frameworks and instruments for cataloguing works of art and cultural objects. By offering project consulting we support the thoughtful application of digital tools and methodologies to humanistic inquiry. We promote (digital) research across all arts and humanities disciplines, but our focal point is the study of art from the Low Countries.

treasury_media.title: Example or Alter Ego? Aspects of the Portrait Historié in Western Art from Antiquity to the Present (Nijmegen Art Historical Studies XXII)
treasury_media.description: The present collection of essays on the subject of the portrait historié is a much-needed study of the artistic, literary and intellectual implications of this subgenre of portraiture. A portrait historié can be described as a portrait in the guise of a mythological, religious, historical or legendary figure. The contributions to this volume shed new light on the diversity of form and content within this subset of portraiture.

projects.title: RemDoc: Rembrandt Documents Project (remdoc.org)
projects.description:
RemDoc: The Rembrandt Documents Project is a new digital infrastructure for accessing, analysing, and interpreting original written and printed documents related to the life and art of the Dutch painter Rembrandt van Rijn (1606-1669). An initiative of the Radboud Univerisity Nijmegen, in cooperation with Huygens ING and Museum Het Rembrandthuis.

RemDoc is digital collection of primary documents that relate to the life and works of Rembrandt, produced from the 15th to 18th century. RemDoc aims to collect and make available all known documents that relate to Rembrandt, as a person and as an artist, as well as to his ancestors and family. 

The RemDoc project subscribes to a modern and inclusive definition of the term ‘document’. Therefore, RemDoc will, for example, include extracts from baptism, marriage, and burial records; the small number of Rembrandt’s own letters; notarial deeds such as contracts, probate inventories, debt and credit records; as well as inscriptions by Rembrandt or his customers on drawings and etchings. RemDoc will also contain advertisements of auctions in newspapers and references to Rembrandt in (published) literary works, such as art theoretical/critical writings and poetry.

The heart of the RemDoc infrastructure will be original documents from the period between 1475 to to about one hundred years after his death. RemDoc will not feature all Rembrandt documents from a later date because, following 1769, their nature changes significantly. Texts become increasingly interpretative rather than factual, and attributions of paintings in auction catalogues rapidly become less reliable. The content of the RemDoc database (scanned images of archival documents and metadata describing these documents) is provided by a range of institutions around the world, mostly archives.

https://www.ru.nl/rich/our-research/research-projects/rembrandt-documents-project/

contributors.headline: Self-Propelled Art Historian | Editor | Graphic Artist | Heritage Specialist | Religious Studies Scholar | PhD at Radboud University Nijmegen

projects.title: Rembench: A Digital Workbench for Rembrandt Research
projects.description:
The aim of this project was to show how historians and art historians could benefit from one of CLARIN's important applications, eLaborate, which is connected to resources from museums, archives and libraries. For this purpose a demonstrator was built with which a number of databases were linked together; the life and works of Rembrandt van Rijn were central to this.

RemBench combines the content of four different databases (of three different project partners) behind one search interface: 

- RKDartists and RKDimages, two databases maintained by the Netherlands Institute for Art History (RKD)
- Rembrandt Documents (RemDoc), a collection of original documents related to Rembrandt van Rijn from the period between 1475 to circa 1750 in a database (using eLaborate), linked with related resources created by the Rijksbureau voor Kunsthistorische Documentatie (RKD).
- RUQuest, a standard university library system that provides access to full text articles, as well as the complete collection of (e-)books and journals from the Radboud University Library Catalogue.

RemBench enables one to search and browse for works of art, artists, primary sources and library sources related to Rembrandt, using faceted search by location, author/artist name, author/artist type, and date range, and/or by both exact and fuzzy keyword search. It offers both a web application and a RESTful web service.

- Prof. dr. Volker Manuth (coördinator, Radboud University Nijmegen)
- Rudie van Leeuwen (Radboud University Nijmegen)
- R. van ‘t Zelfde/J. Teuben (Rijksbureau voor Kunsthistorische Documentatie)
- Drs. Guido Gerritsen (Huygens ING)
- Ing. R.D. Gouw (Radboud University Nijmegen)
http://www.clarin.nl/node/1404

contributors.headline: Self-Propelled Art Historian | Editor | Graphic Artist | Heritage Specialist | Religious Studies Scholar | PhD at Radboud University Nijmegen

projects.title: Dealing with the Religious Past: Constructions of Christian cultural heritage, Research spearhead program Christian Cultural Heritage (CCE) within the research institute Historical, Literary and Cultural Studies (HLCS), Faculty of Arts, Radboud University
projects.description:
Dealing with the religious past, Research program Christian Cultural Heritage (CCE), HLCS/Faculty of Arts, Radboud University Nijmegen: Project Ad Fontis / Terug naar de bron, initiated i.a. by Prof. dr. S. de Blaauw.
The starting point of the "Dealing with the religious past" program was that dealing with Christian cultural heritage in secularized societies such as the Netherlands is extra vulnerable to neglect and (anachronistic) projection and therefore requires explicit scientific reflection. One should focus on constructions and functions of Christian cultural heritage and the dynamics between heritage and memorial communities from a broad cultural-historical vision. This research can be synchronous (for example, comparing between confessions, or between Christian and Islamic heritage) or diachronic in design. A longitudinal perspective, like international comparative analysis, can reveal and explain continuity and discontinuity in dealing with Christian heritage. It is the ambition of the research focus area "Dealing with the religious past" to analyze the history of the handling and transmission of Christian heritage from a broad cultural-historical approach. Within the interdisciplinary research group (historians, art historians, literary experts), shared or overlapping specializations are emerging, which enable more intensive collaboration.
The theme revolves around three concepts: 1.) Religious / Christian culture 2.) Identity 3.) Heritage. 
CCE/DRP/conceptnotitie expertmeeting 10102008/MM
My contribution resulted in the publication "You want to take us to Jerusalem …' Medinat Weimar: A Second Jerusalem in Contemporary Visual Arts and Klezmer Songs", in 'The imagined and real Jerusalem in art and architecture' (2014), a collection of essays which calls attention to two axes emerging from the study of Jerusalem in art: on the one hand, the volatile contemporary situation, and on the other hand, the abiding chain of meanings that history imparts to the city.

profile_positions.description:
The Karel van Mander Academy (Arnhem) is a group of scholars, who offer ready to use guidelines for the description of art, architecture, and develop conceptual frameworks and instruments for cataloguing works of art and other cultural objects.

Together with various colleagues and partners of the KVMA, I am committed to:
1.) catologuing collections and galleries of portraits of nobility from territories that were once part of the Holy Roman Empire (Project: POTENS: Portraits and Titulature of European Nobility Search).
2.) art historical research into the world of the Dutch children's book and its illustrators (Project: INGEPRENT).
3.) editing and publishing (artist) monographs and overviews with regard to Dutch visual culture and patronage (KVMA Series for Visual Heritage in the Netherlands), varying from seventeenth-century dolls' houses to computer game history (Project: HiDuViGa: History of Dutch Videogames).

By offering project consulting we support the thoughtful application of digital tools and methodologies to humanistic inquiry. We promote (digital) research across all arts and humanities disciplines, but our focal point is the study of art from the Low Countries (The Netherlands and Flanders).
profile_positions.title: Researcher

Targets
-	connecting existing databases with portraits of European nobility

-	network visualisation of provenance research within a genealogical context

profile_positions.description:
Advisor Cultural Embedding (External Consultant).  Helping companies transform from a platform-based start-up to a community of culture carriers by designing a brand culture and building a non-hierarchical context (i.e. finding common ground), necessary for the execution of organizational strategies from an ideological framework. 
I encourage personal upskilling and create ideological awareness from a historical perspective through self-development, pressure-free education, and academic learning by creating open-ended content. Specifically, I write columns and blogs about historical subjects, and I give advice.
I add a non-committal cultural perspective to corporate branding by embedding the brand in mainstream ideologies and subcultures. In this way I contribute to gaining traction (large number of users/followers) and harness cultural momentum for business success.
profile_positions.title: Independent Advisor

profile_positions.title: Editor

profile_positions.description:
Thesis: Portraits of rulers and burghers as biblical figures: The biblical "portrait historié" in the Northern and Southern Netherlands in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries.
Since the Middle Ages rulers and burghers have been portrayed in the guise of well-known biblical figures. In these portraits historiés individuals could, for example, be depicted as the Old Testament king David, or the shepherds adoring Christ. The Modern Devotion stimulated an intimate relationship with biblical figures, and portraits historiés in Passion scenes reflect such spiritual notions. Through biblical portraiture, people could place themselves in the skin of heroes of faith, such as the Apostles at the Last Supper, and be part of the cloud of witnesses. In the Reformation era, the portrait historié proved a suitable means for propagating adherence to a certain denomination. The individuals portrayed used the well-known visual language of the bible to take a stance in theological debates and to make this complex matter intelligible. In the Northern Netherlands of the seventeenth century, the biblical portrait history flourished as a subset of both history and portrait painting.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Phd Candidate

profile_positions.description:
Desipientia: Kunsthistorisch Tijdschrift

The art historical magazine Desipientia is attached to the Department of Art History at the Radboud University in Nijmegen and the Alumni Organisation Art History and Archaeology. Tasks: choosing themes, subjects, authors; editing  articles; marketing strategies; organizing events such as conferences.
profile_positions.title: Editor in Chief

profile_positions.description:
Portrait Historié Database (PortHis). An extension of a research project by the Department of Art History of the historicised portrait in western art is the construction of the Portrait Historié database. The database originally contained works of art created in the Netherlands' Golden Century. The database was transferred to the CKD and is supplemented with Portraits Historiés from the whole of western art history.
https://www.ru.nl/rich/our-research/affiliated-institutes/centrum-voor-kunsthistorische-documentatie/databases/porthis/zoeken/
